questions.question: What is the effect of the adsorbate concentration on the adsorption preference of MIL-53 for p-xylene compared to m-xylene?

questions.question: What determines the order of selectivity among xylene isomers in MIL-53 at low concentrations?
questions.answer: The strength of interaction between the methyl groups of the adsorbates and the carboxylate groups of the MIL-53 framework.

questions.question: Why does MIL-53 have a different selectivity pattern compared to MIL-47 for adsorption of alkylaromatics?
questions.answer: The presence of different metals in MIL-53 and MIL-47 leads to different polarization of the carboxylate groups, affecting the strength of interaction with the adsorbates.

questions.question: What is the relationship between the degree of pore filling and selectivity in MIL-53 for C8 alkylaromatics?
questions.answer: The selectivity increases with the degree of pore filling due to differences in molecular packing efficiency among the isomers.

questions.question: How does the presence of two methyl groups in o-xylene influence its interaction with MIL-53?
questions.answer: Both methyl groups in o-xylene can interact with the carboxylate groups of the MIL-53 framework, leading to stronger adsorption.
